sentences.sentence: of the Kremlin to 25 years in prison for charges of treason and denigrating the Russian army prominent opposition activist Karamurza has been behind bars since his arrest in Moscow last April. He has pleaded his innocence rejecting the charges against him as political and even comparing the legal proceedings against him to the Stalin show trials of the Soviet era. The charges against him stem from a speech he gave to the Arizona House of Representatives in March 2022, in which he denounced Russia's military action in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Russia adopted a law criminalizing spreading false information about its military shortly after it sent troops to Ukraine in February last year. Authorities have used the law to silence critics and independent voices. Kara Mirza's health has deteriorated since being in prison, losing a reported 22 kilos in weight since entering pre-trial detention.

The civil unrest broke out between the Sudanese armed forces and their former allies, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces Group, who are fighting over a proposed transition to civilian rule.

sentences.sentence: The military said it would not negotiate with the RSF, pledging to dismantle the group instead.

sentences.sentence: The two factions jointly orchestrated a military coup in October 2021 that derailed Sudan's short-lived transition to democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Both militaries are waging a street-by-street and even house-by-house battle for control of the city, said Sergei Cherevaty of the Eastern Grouping of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

sentences.sentence: The UK's defence ministry issued its daily intelligence update about the situation in Ukraine, focusing on the consequences of mining the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Over 750 mine-related casualties among civilians have been reported since the start of the full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: One in eight has involved a child. It will likely take at least a decade to clear Ukraine of mines. Mine-related civilian casualties continue to be reported daily in Ukraine. The most affected areas are Kherson and Kharkiv regions, areas Russia has previously occupied. With the arrival of spring and more people involved in agricultural activities, the risk of civilian mine incidents will increase.

sentences.sentence: Italian authorities have seized around two tonnes of cocaine worth more than 400 million euros floating at sea off Sicily's eastern coast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The country's tax and customs police have called it a record haul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The drugs were stored and sealed in 70 waterproof packages, held together by fishing nets and equipped with a luminous signalling device.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Police said the peculiar packaging method suggests it was likely dumped at sea by a cargo ship to be recovered later on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The UN's Office on Drugs and Crime says global cocaine production is at its highest level on record.

sentences.sentence: 800 detainees have been freed in Yemen after a major prisoner exchange concluded on Sunday, marking the largest swap in the war since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over three days, five flights carrying nearly 200 detainees flew between the Bara'a capital of Sana'a and the government-controlled northern city of Marib.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.sentence: At Chebele Square in the heart of Madrid, around 20,000 people have gathered for the first edition of the Resurrection Festival, a musical event to celebrate the end of Easter.
